intro: Campylopora australiana, commonly known as the Australian coral tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive coral-like inflorescences. The plant features palmate leaves and produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Campylopora australiana is well adapted to a range of soil types and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
